verses.roman:
taṁ vidvān api dāśārho
bhagavān sarva-darśanaḥ
anvamodata tat-sakhyaṁ
vadhaṁ tasya vicintayan

synonyms: tam—him, Pralambāsura; vidvān—knowing quite well; api—even though; dāśārhaḥ—the descendant of Daśārha; bhagavān—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; sarva-darśanaḥ—the omniscient; anvamodata—accepted; tat—with him; sakhyam—friendship; vadham—the killing; tasya—of him; vicintayan—meditating upon.
translation: Since the Supreme Lord Kṛṣṇa, who had appeared in the Daśārha dynasty, sees everything, He understood who the demon was. Still, the Lord pretended to accept the demon as a friend, while at the same time seriously considering how to kill him.
